intro: Myristica niohue, commonly known as the Chilean nutmeg, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andes mountains of Chile. It belongs to the Myristicaceae family and is closely related to the nutmeg tree, but it is not related to the spice nutmeg. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent. The tree is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional medicine in South America.
